p: The Salicaceae family contains 56 genera from which two intensively studied and reported for a wide range of biological activities: Populus and Salix [ 3]. This family includes woody plants, which have alternate leaves. The fruit is a valvicidal capsule and the seeds have hairs; this anatomical aspect helps the species to reproduce because the spread is done through the wind. The flowers are grouped in clusters and have no floral covering [ 4]. They appear mainly through the northern temperate regions, ranging from North America through Eurasia and Africa. This family has high adaptability that allows them to occupy significant territories, due to common features such as easy dissemination through the wind and high regeneration capacity [ 2].
